channel.title: Your worst hardware disaster
channel.description:
Post them here, kgo.
My worst is I accidentally tried to boot a computer with a stick of ram in the wrong way, there was two notches on the stick and somehow thought I got it in because the latch went in - turns out those sticks had two notches and one end was half sticking out. Not that bad really, but I am pretty damn orsm.
The worst thing that's happened that wasn't my fault was when a cockroach crawled into the psu and blew up - smelled pretty bad.

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

My 250gb HDD fried on me… I have no clue how, but the plastic female joint of the HDD broke and the male joint of the power connector was sparking…

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

A few months ago, I was on my laptop while eating olives and the olive juice shit spilled all over it. Ended up having to replace the keyboard and in the process of doing so I broke a hole in the case in frustration of not being able to unscrew a certain screw – the tip was all worn out and shit so I just yanked the case out.

Read full topic

item.description:

my dad ripped out my hard drive. That’s the only hardware disaster I’ve ever had.

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @ekmannen ekmannen
item.description:
@ekmannen wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:30, topic:368530”][quote author=ekmannen link=topic=464676.msg3404264#msg3404264 date=1290206481]
I once tried to install XP on my Vista machine, with dualboot. (You know why.) Then the computer froze in the middle of the partitioning prosess. I restarted it, but didn’t get past the BIOS. Oh, what glorious memory of my dad getting angry that day. Luckily it was the cheapest computer we had ever bought.
[/quote]
yes because a failed partitioning causes physical damage to the computer…???[/quote]
I have no idea how it really happened. It just froze in the middle of the process. And the BIOS wouldn’t format the drive either.

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:21, topic:368530”]I accidentally scratched some thermal paste off my cpu and it was idling at like 80C. Not much of a disaster since I reapplied some more and screwed the fan on 9999 tight; afterwards all was fine.

Not computer related, but one time I was really bored so I thought it would be a great idea to get my guitar cable: connect one end to output and the other in input of my amp. This resulted in the amp to simply stop working however it was relatively new so I brought it back to the shop and gave me a better amp as a replacement :)[/quote]

FYI, on earth, idling is measured in RPM.

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I accidentally scratched some thermal paste off my cpu and it was idling at like 80C. Not much of a disaster since I reapplied some more and screwed the fan on 9999 tight; afterwards all was fine.

Not computer related, but one time I was really bored so I thought it would be a great idea to get my guitar cable: connect one end to output and the other in input of my amp. This resulted in the amp to simply stop working however it was relatively new so I brought it back to the shop and gave me a better amp as a replacement

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:11, topic:368530”]I have a couple. I shall add to this post when I think of more.

Was carrying up a HDD up the stairs once, Remember kids: Don’t run up the stairs. A nano-second later after starting to rush the HDD slipped out my hand and fell half way down the stairs, my head went down and my back become hunched every time I heard and felt the thump of it bouncing off the stair… Turns out it worked fine. Weird thing is, its a 15 year old HDD. Go knows what its been through before I touched it.

A while back I was disassembling one of these: http://www.retroisle.com/amstrad/pcw/Pictures/images_pcw/PCW9512/PCW.jpg

I was taking the CRT downstairs, but it was just the tube, the stairs wasnt the problem this time! It almost slipped out hands three times but once I got to the back door, I opened the door and knocked the gun and then shit myself as I heard this loud hissing, practically threw it out the back door and slammed the back door waiting for it to explode/implode… That scared the FUCK out of me, the sudden HISSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS…[/quote]

I have an old 40 gig hard disk that says ‘warranty void if exposed to shocks in excess of 350 gs’

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Screw was stuck in with a bolt on the back of a MOBO of mine. Had to use pliers on one end and a wrench on the other. Pliers slipped in my hands and there goes a deep gash into 4 traces. Bye.

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

never really had a disaster, once i bought a 750w power supply off ebay for $30 when i knew nothing about PSU’s. powered my 7300gs for about 2 days before blowing up, not taking out any other parts of my pc.

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The only ‘disaster’ I remember was when I bought a new phone. I had a memory card that I bought with my previous phone, and decided that it would fit in my new one. So without thinking about it I put the card in my new phone. I was surprised when I found out that it was too small.

Had fun trying to get it out though.

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I have two that I remember. Once when I was little, spilled coke all over my laptop, started smoking. I got a new, improved one for free from HP though.
The other was when I had a ATi Radeon HD 2400 Pro. I only had a CRT monitor, but I had gotten a vr920 to try it out. It was pretty cool, I was playing fs9 and I told my dad to try it out. As he was flying I was plugging the CRT in to fly while he watches through the HMD. Bad idea. He got shocked, the graphics card got fried, and the magnets within the VR920 that enable headtracking to work got fucked. Luckily I was able to return the HMD (I pretty much planned that anyways, it was cool but way too expensive) + get a new graphics card free due to warranty.

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

bootnecklad:

That scared the FUCK out of me, the sudden HISSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS…

crt hiss is awesome

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Not really computer hardware but I bought a headphone amp and the twats who sent it gave me the wrong plug size which I didn’t realise until I was about to plug it in. A few blue arks etc, slight burning smell.

Other than that the only other hardware damage would be while I was trying to unplug a sata cable, it was one of those crappy $0.10 china cables with the button you have to press down to release(which don’t release at all), yanked the bloody plastic bit to hold the cable off the motherboard. Mobo boots slower but other than that no damage.

Read full topic

item.title: Your worst hardware disaster
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Oh, I just remembered one that was a lot more funny to watch than it probably is to hear about.

We literally JUST finished building my neighbours brand new PC, awesome looking case and everything, were walking back round to his, he was carrying it, his dad had parked a motorcycle trailer across the entrance to their driveway which you totally couldn’t see in the dark, he trips over it and fucking throws the PC down the drive. Didn’t even get to plug it in and install the OS before it needed some TLC.

He was mad, I was laughing my arse off.

Read full topic
